definition: to go underground/to turn to secret activities
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Dodonna and Tallon parted ways, with both going into hiding.
sentences.chinese: 多登納和塔隆分道揚鑣，都轉入地下。

sentences.english: An outlawed political group has no choice but to go underground.
sentences.chinese: 非法政治組織只能轉入地下活動。

sentences.english: Aproblem becomes more difficult if it goes underground.
sentences.chinese: 如果一個問題轉入地下，將變得更加困難。

sentences.english: But sometimes, going underground isthe only option.
sentences.chinese: 但有時，轉入地下是唯一的選擇。
